justification: The article notes that “The second class of signals, maximal over motor areas, corresponds to classic effector-selective motor preparation activities such as the lateralized readiness potential.”

These motor-preparatory activities are also indexed by “the decrease in spectral activity in the mu/beta band,” which is listed alongside the lateralized readiness potential as a marker of motor preparation.

The manuscript states, “The first class of signals corresponds to the centro-parietal positivity, and reflects stimulus categorization,” directly linking the CPP component to the construct of stimulus categorization.

In describing EMG, the authors explain that “researchers typically consider the (full-wave) rectified EMG signal… The amplitude of a rectified EMG burst reflects global muscle activation,” indicating that rectified EMG is the measure used to capture muscle activation.
